title: Hint
text:
$$1$$. We start with the point-slope form of a line:
(y - y₁) $$=$$ m(x - x₁)

$$2$$. Substitute the given slope $$m$$ $$=$$ $$-3$$ and the coordinates of the point $$(4,8)$$ into the formula:
(y - 8) $$=$$ -3(x - 4)

$$3$$. Distribute $$-3$$ on the right-hand side:
$$y$$ - $$8$$ $$=$$ $$-3x$$ + $$12$$
